conclusion: Analyze motion of charged particle through magnetic and electric fields, breaking into two parts: motion in magnetic field and motion in electric field.
Initial conditions: Particle injected from origin with initial velocity at 45-degree angle to y-axis.
Velocity components are v_ix = v_i/sqrt(2) and v_iy = v_i/sqrt(2).
Magnetic field is perpendicular to plane and points inward.
Magnetic force acts as centripetal force causing circular motion.
Radius of circular path is r = mv_i/qB.
Particle moves in circular path in fourth quadrant.
Time to complete quarter-circle is t_B = pi m/(2qB).
Upon reaching x-axis, particle enters electric field directed along negative y-axis.
Velocity at this point is purely horizontal v_ix = v_i.
Electric force acts downward.
Acceleration due to electric field is a = qE/m.
Particle moves with constant horizontal velocity and accelerates vertically due to electric field.
Horizontal motion gives x = v_i t_E = 3L, so t_E = 3L/v_i.
Vertical motion described by y = (1/2) a t_E^2 = L.
Substituting a = qE/m and t_E = 3L/v_i gives L = (1/2)(qE/m)(3L/v_i)^2.
v_i^2 = 9qEL/m.
Total time from O to P is t = t_B + t_E = pi m/(2qB) + 3L/v_i.
Using v_i^2 = 9qEL/m, find v_i = sqrt(9qEL/m).
Substitute v_i into t_E: t_E = sqrt(mL/qE).
Total time is t = pi m/(2qB) + sqrt(mL/qE).
